critique: The document aims to provide pensions to veterans and their dependents. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy from those who will benefit from these pensions. There's also an element of sadness addressed, as the document deals with disability and death. There might be some fear among those who are not sure if they qualify, and perhaps some disgust at the thought of those who might try to take advantage of the system. Surprise is less relevant here. The language is formal and legalistic, which tempers strong emotional responses. The initial scores reflect this.
